intro: Rollandia crispa var. muricata, commonly known as the rough-stemmed rollandia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
